Key Match Events: Buddy Hield led all scorers with 18 points and four 3-pointers.
Brandin Podziemski had a productive all-around game with nine points, seven rebounds, and five assists.
Podziemski made a spectacular behind-the-back pass to Jonathan Kuminga for a two-hand slam.
Stephen Curry made a high arching fadeaway shot just before halftime.
Buddy Hield hit a 28-foot three-pointer over Marcus Smart at the end of the third quarter.
Draymond Green scored 13 points with eight rebounds and seven assists, shooting 3-for-7 from deep.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Golden State won their fourth consecutive game at Chase Center, improving to 4-1 at home.
The Warriors are now 8-1 vs. teams from the Western Conference.
The Warriors have started 10-2 or better six times since the 2014-15 season.
Golden State’s reserves lead the NBA in scoring at 58.8 points per game.
The Warriors bench scored 67 points, marking the fifth time this season tallying 60-plus points.
The Warriors won their fifth-straight home game vs. the Grizzlies.
Golden State has won 11 of the last 13 games vs. Memphis played at home.
The Warriors improved to 4-1 in clutch games this season.
Golden State leads West Group C with a 2-0 record in Emirates NBA Cup Group Play.
The Warriors improved to 8-0 when scoring 120-plus points.
The Warriors improved to 6-1 when dishing out 30-plus assists.
Golden State improved to 6-0 when grabbing 50-or-more rebounds.
Tonight marked the Warriors’ 523rd consecutive sellout, the third longest active streak in the NBA.
Draymond Green made a season-high-tying three 3-pointers.
The Warriors are now 55-7 all-time in regular season games in which Green makes at least three 3-pointers.
Stephen Curry recorded a season-high-tying four steals.
Buddy Hield led the Warriors in scoring with 18 points off the bench.
Kyle Anderson returned to action after missing the last game due to a right neck spasm.
